items.title: Regression: Error `conda.core.link:_execute(502)` installing selected packages from condaforge
items.body:
## Current Behavior re-installing a previously exported environment fails. This appears to be a regression in the past week, since this was working when I tested https://github.com/e-mission/e-mission-docker/commit/c66f1c881bc97479816b07536243b5b8feb54f95 but broke when I was testing the TravisCI integration (around `Thu Mar 12 23:15:25 2020`). Since I am using a docker container, my version of conda has not changed, and the packages I am installing have not changed, so I'm guess that this is due to some change in the way `conda-forge` exports packages. ### Steps to Reproduce #### Launch a docker container with the environment installed, created when it was working. ``` $ docker run -it emission/e-mission-server:2.8.0 /bin/bash ``` #### Confirm that the existing environment has the expected version of cachetools ``` (base) root@d09695041e02:/usr/src/app# source activate emission (emission) root@d09695041e02:/usr/src/app# conda list | grep cachetools cachetools 2.1.0 py_0 conda-forge ``` #### Try to recreate the environment with a different name -> fails because of cachetools error ``` # conda env update --name testbug --file setup/environment36.yml Preparing transaction: done Verifying transaction: done Executing transaction: failed ERROR conda.core.link:_execute(507): An error occurred while installing package 'conda-forge::cachetools-2.1.0-py_0'. FileNotFoundError(2, "No such file or directory: '/opt/conda/envs/testbug/bin/python3.6'") Attempting to roll back. Rolling back transaction: done FileNotFoundError(2, "No such file or directory: '/opt/conda/envs/testbug/bin/python3.6'") ``` #### Try to install cachetools manually, also fails = regression! ``` (emission) root@d09695041e02:/usr/src/appconda install -c conda-forge cachetools-2.1.0-py_0 Solving environment: failed PackagesNotFoundError: The following packages are not available from current channels: - cachetools-2.1.0-py_0 Current channels: - https://conda.anaconda.org/conda-forge/linux-64 - https://conda.anaconda.org/conda-forge/noarch - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/linux-64 - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/noarch - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/linux-64 - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/noarch - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/linux-64 - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/noarch - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/linux-64 - https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/noarch To search for alternate channels that may provide the conda package you're looking for, navigate to https://anaconda.org and use the search bar at the top of the page. ``` Note that the package is clearly available in conda-forge. ## Expected Behavior The environment should be installed, since it has been successfully installed in the past. ## Environment Information
`conda info`

``` # conda info active environment : emission active env location : /opt/conda/envs/emission shell level : 2 user config file : /root/.condarc populated config files : conda version : 4.5.12 conda-build version : not installed python version : 3.7.1.final.0 base environment : /opt/conda (writable) channel URLs : https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/linux-64 https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/noarch https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/linux-64 https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/free/noarch https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/linux-64 https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/r/noarch https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/linux-64 https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/pro/noarch package cache : /opt/conda/pkgs /root/.conda/pkgs envs directories : /opt/conda/envs /root/.conda/envs platform : linux-64 user-agent : conda/4.5.12 requests/2.21.0 CPython/3.7.1 Linux/4.19.76-linuxkit debian/9 glibc/2.24 UID:GID : 0:0 netrc file : None offline mode : False ```

`conda config --show-sources`

``` # conda config --show-sources ```

`conda list --show-channel-urls`

``` # conda list --show-channel-urls # packages in environment at /opt/conda/envs/emission: # # Name Version Build Channel arrow 0.12.1 py36_1002 conda-forge asn1crypto 0.24.0 attrdict 2.0.0 py_1 conda-forge blas 1.0 mkl defaults ca-certificates 2019.3.9 hecc5488_0 conda-forge cachetools 2.1.0 py_0 conda-forge certifi 2019.3.9 py36_0 conda-forge cffi 1.12.2 cheroot 6.2.4 py36_0 conda-forge cryptography 2.6.1 future 0.16.0 py36_1002 conda-forge geojson 2.3.0 py_0 conda-forge google-auth 1.2.1 py_0 conda-forge intel-openmp 2019.3 199 defaults jsonpickle 0.9.6 py_1 conda-forge jwcrypto 0.4.2 libgcc-ng 8.2.0 hdf63c60_1 defaults libgfortran 3.0.0 1 conda-forge lxml 4.3.2 mkl 2017.0.4 h4c4d0af_0 defaults more-itertools 4.3.0 py36_1000 conda-forge ncurses 5.9 10 conda-forge numpy 1.12.1 py36_0 defaults openssl 1.0.2r h14c3975_0 conda-forge pandas 0.20.1 np112py36_0 conda-forge pip 9.0.1 py36_1 conda-forge pyasn1 0.4.4 py_1 conda-forge pyasn1-modules 0.2.4 py_0 conda-forge pycparser 2.19 pyfcm 1.4.3 pygeocoder 1.2.5 pykml 0.1.3 pymongo 3.5.1 python 3.6.1 2 conda-forge python-dateutil 2.6.0 py36_0 conda-forge pytz 2017.2 py36_0 conda-forge readline 6.2 0 conda-forge requests 2.14.2 py36_0 defaults requests-toolbelt 0.9.1 rsa 3.4.2 py_1 conda-forge scikit-learn 0.18.1 np112py36_1 defaults scipy 0.19.0 np112py36_0 defaults setuptools 40.8.0 py36_0 conda-forge six 1.12.0 py36_1000 conda-forge sqlite 3.13.0 1 conda-forge tk 8.5.19 2 conda-forge utm 0.4.2 py36_0 conda-forge wheel 0.33.1 py36_0 conda-forge xmltodict 0.11.0 py_1 conda-forge xz 5.2.4 h14c3975_1001 conda-forge zlib 1.2.11 h14c3975_1004 conda-forge ```

This is an issue tracker for conda -- the package manager.  File feature requests
for conda here, as well as bug reports about something conda has messed up.

Anaconda Community Code of Conduct: https://www.anaconda.com/community-code-of-conduct/

If your issue is a feature request for:
  * a specific conda package from Anaconda ('defaults' channel):
      ==> file at https://github.com/ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues
  * a specific conda package from conda-forge:
      ==> file at the corresponding feedstock under https://github.com/conda-forge
  * repo.anaconda.com access and service:
      ==> file at https://github.com/ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues
  * anaconda.org access and service:
      ==> file at https://anaconda.org/contact/report
  * commands under 'conda build':
      ==> file at https://github.com/conda/conda-build
  * commands under 'conda env':
      ==> please file it here!
  * all other conda commands that start with 'conda':
      ==> please file it here!
	add command 
	
	conda config --add  custom_channels  'xxx: https://xxxx'
-->
  * all other conda commands that start with 'conda':
      ==> please file it here!
	add command 
	
	conda config --add  custom_channels  'xxx: https://xxxx'

items.title: conda remove erased directories not from a conda environment
items.body:
**I'm submitting a...** - [x ] bug report ## Current Behavior `conda remove -p /dss/dssfs02/lwp-dss-0001/pn69xe/pn69xe-dss-0000/di52zuy --all` removed all my files and directories even though they were not an environment. The intended command was `conda remove -p /dss/dssfs02/lwp-dss-0001/pn69xe/pn69xe-dss-0000/di52zuy/ignite_tools_py3 --all` but the environment name was not added by mistake. Result: **2.5Tb** of data are gone... ### Steps to Reproduce Use of `conda remove` with a PATH that is not an environment. ``` conda remove -p /dss/dssfs02/lwp-dss-0001/pn69xe/pn69xe-dss-0000/di52zuy --all ``` ## Expected Behavior Conda should be able to know what is a conda env and what not. Erasing all directories and files without checking first (not sure if this is true) is not ideal. ## Environment Information
